short_summary: Correction of AECL doses in the NDR, and Mortality and Cancer Incidence Analysis of Canadian NEWs
description: The contractor will:">identify all discrepancies and recommend corrective measures. Review and describe characteristics of AECL links and non-links to the NDR. Create a corrected AECL file, through discussions with HC and the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission (CNSC).b. Replicate and compare an analysis published by AECL in 1993 (Gribbin, Weeks et al. 1993) using the corrected AECL file and mortality follow-up to 1990. Report is about validation and correction of AECL doses (a.), dose-response analysis (b.) and additions of early AECL doses in the NDR (c.).
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement
## Overview

Health Canada is seeking a contractor to validate the National Dose Registry (NDR) database and conduct a mortality and cancer incidence analysis of Canadian nuclear energy workers.

### Background

The National Dose Registry is a database containing information on occupational exposure to ionizing radiation for Atomic Energy of Canada Limited (AECL) workers. The current objective is to ensure the database contains accurate dose data.

### Objectives and Requirements

The contractor will:

*   Review and compare AECL source files with the NDR database, identifying discrepancies and recommending corrective measures
*   Conduct a dose-response analysis of ionizing radiation exposure and health outcomes
*   Collaborate with Health Canada and the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission to agree on any necessary corrections to the NDR
*   Conduct a detailed statistical analysis of the NDR's Canadian nuclear energy workers cohort, including a comparison of mortality and cancer incidence rates with the general Canadian population
*   Collaborate with Health Canada and the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission to prepare a scientific proposal for an updated mortality and cancer incidence analysis

### Reporting Requirements

The contractor is required to submit a comprehensive report, including:

*   Background and context
*   Methods and data analysis
*   Results and conclusions
*   Recommendations

### Key Dates

*   Tender closing date: February 8, 2023
*   Expected contract start date: To be determined
*   Expected contract end date: To be determined

### Additional Information

*   The contractor will be required to participate in tender evaluation activities and respond to any inquiries from Health Canada
*   The contractor will be required to provide a detailed budget and timeline for the project

### Contact Information

Please direct any questions or inquiries to Wesley Phillips at 613-941-2067 or wesley.phillips@canada.ca.

Note: This tender announcement is subject to change, and Health Canada reserves the right to modify or cancel the contract at any time.
